visualizer.display
Class Layouts

java.lang.Object
  visualizer.display.Layouts

public class Layouts
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains only static methods that will compute a specific layout like a Morton Z-Curve for a set of items.

Author:
Rene Wegener

Layouts

public Layouts()
Method Detail

createRowLayout

public static void createRowLayout(java.util.ArrayList v,
                                   int startX,
                                   int startY,
                                   int itemWidth,
                                   int itemHeight)
create a layout row by row. As for all methods, several parameters have to be given: v is a vector holding the Points that will be arranged. startX and startY are the x- and y- coordinates at which the layout algorithm will start to place the points. itemWidth and itemHeight represent the size of the items that shall be placed. This algorithm tries to create a square matrix.

createRowLayout

public static void createRowLayout(java.util.ArrayList v,
                                   int startX,
                                   int startY,
                                   int itemWidth,
                                   int itemHeight,
                                   int matrixWidth,
                                   int matrixHeight)
create a layout row by row. As for all methods, several parameters have to be given: v is a vector holding the Points that will be arranged. startX and startY are the x- and y- coordinates at which the layout algorithm will start to place the points. itemWidth and itemHeight represent the size of the items that shall be placed. matrixWidth and matrixHeight define the desired size of the whole matrix.

createTable2D

public static void createTable2D(java.util.ArrayList v,
                                 int startX,
                                 int startY,
                                 int itemWidth,
                                 int itemHeight,
                                 GlyphTable gt)

createColumnLayout

public static void createColumnLayout(java.util.ArrayList v,
                                      int startX,
                                      int startY,
                                      int itemWidth,
                                      int itemHeight,
                                      int matrixWidth,
                                      int matrixHeight)
create a layout column by column. As for all methods, several parameters have to be given: v is a vector holding the Points that will be arranged. startX and startY are the x- and y- coordinates at which the layout algorithm will start to place the points. itemWidth and itemHeight represent the size of the items that shall be placed. matrixWidth and matrixHeight define the desired size of the whole matrix.

createZLayout

public static void createZLayout(java.util.ArrayList v,
                                 int startX,
                                 int startY,
                                 int itemWidth,
                                 int itemHeight)
Create a recursive Morton Z-Curve. Although the method will work on a set of items of any size, the best result is achieved if the size is a number 4^n. The meaning of the parameters is the same as for the method createSimpleLayout.

createFlexibleZLayout

public static void createFlexibleZLayout(java.util.ArrayList v,
                                         int startX,
                                         int startY,
                                         int itemWidth,
                                         int itemHeight)
Create a recursive Z-Curve that tries to create a square even on item sets of a size that's far bigger or smaller than 4^n. The meaning of the parameters is the same as for the method createSimpleLayout.

createLineLayout

public static void createLineLayout(java.util.ArrayList v,
                                    int startX,
                                    int startY,
                                    int itemHeight,
                                    int itemWidth)
Create a layout similar to a simple row layout but with rows of a width of four pixels. This might result in a more intuitive visualization than the simple row layout. The meaning of the parameters is the same as for the method createSimpleLayout.

createRecursiveLayout

public static void createRecursiveLayout(java.util.ArrayList v,
                                         int startX,
                                         int startY,
                                         int itemWidth,
                                         int itemHeight)
At the moment not implemented correctly.

createHilbertLayout

public static void createHilbertLayout(java.util.ArrayList v,
                                       int startX,
                                       int startY,
                                       int itemWidth,
                                       int itemHeight)
Create a recursive Hilbert Curve. Although the method will work on a set of items of any size, the best result is achieved if the size is a number 4^n. The meaning of the parameters is the same as for the method createSimpleLayout.

curveSize

public static int curveSize(int num)
Compute the width/height of s square that is just big enough to hold num data values.
